definition: name/noun (part of speech)/place (e.g. among winners)/famous/classifier for people

to divide/to separate/to distribute/to allocate/to distinguish (good and bad)/part or subdivision/fraction/one tenth (of certain units)/unit of length equivalent to 0.33 cm/minute (unit of time)/minute (angular measurement unit)/a point (in sports or games)/0.01 yuan (unit of money)

sentences.english: So he swore an oath to him, selling his birthright to Jacob.
sentences.chinese: 以扫就对他起了誓，把长子的名分卖给雅各。

sentences.english: Xunzi's emphasis is to find out who their particular sub-days.
sentences.chinese: 荀子所强调的是要弄明白天和人各自的名分。

sentences.english: And Esau said, Behold, I am at the point to die: and what profit shall this birthright do to me?
sentences.chinese: 以扫说，我将要死，这长子的名分于我有什么益处呢。

sentences.english: He ate and drank, and then got up and left. So Esau despised his birthright.
sentences.chinese: 这就是以扫轻看了他长子的名分。

sentences.english: Sad indeed were this the case, for we should know nothing of sonship.
sentences.chinese: 很遗憾的，在这个看法中，我们无法了解儿子的名分。

sentences.english: To redeem them that were under the law, that we might receive the adoption of sons.
sentences.chinese: 要把律法以下的人赎出来，叫我们得着儿子的名分。

definition: (of a title, degree etc) illegitimately conferred
pinyin: ming2 bu5 zheng4 yan2 bu5 shun4

definition: in a way that justifies the use of the term/genuine/proper/in a way that conforms to logic/justifiable/appropriate/perfectly legitimate
to confer a title upon sb/to dub/to crown/to invest with rank or title
(of a woman) to marry a man of lower social status/to marry down
lit. has a name but no reality (idiom); exists only in name/nominal
